BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: South County Community Health Center Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of South County Community Health Center (SCCHC) is to improve the health status of the community we serve by providing high quality, culturally competent primary and preventative health care, and dental care to people of all ages regardless of ability to pay.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of South County Community Health Center (SCCHC) is to improve the health status of the community we serve by providing high quality, culturally competent primary and preventative health care, and dental care to people of all ages regardless of ability to pay.
IRS990.Desc: Clinical Operations:As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), South County Community Health Center, Inc. (SCCHC) provides a seamless continuum of care that includes patient exams, preventive care, referrals for additional services, and careful follow up. Services are provided at our Ravenswood Family health Center site in East Palo Alto, California. Services include prenatal care, chronic disease care and management, health education, family planning, behavioral health counseling, women's health, pharmacy, dental care, and referrals for social services and specialty care. Our second site is Ravenswood Family Dentistry also in East Palo Alto.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Resource Center Operations:Resource Center Operations provide leasing arrangements for space to other non-profit agencies in the East Palo Alto, California area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCCHC is exempt from income taxes under Section 501 C (3) of the Internal Revenue Code and 23701d of the California Revenue and Taxation Code. SCCHC files the necessary informational returns.GAAP provides accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by SCCHC in its federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. SCCHCs returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three years and four years respectively after they are filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The persons listed at Part IV above are board members and officers of the filing organization as well as the related organization, RFHC Bay Pulgas Landowner, Inc. Please refer to Schedule O for an explanation of the relationship between both entities. Please refer to Schedule R for details of the transactions between both entities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is reviewed by all members of the Board of Directors. In addition, each board member must sign a verification form stating they reviewed the Form 990 before it was filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All conflicts of interest must be disclosed to the Executive Committee, the Board of Directors or to the members of Committees. A review of the conflict will be conducted and the appropriate action will be taken.All trustees, directors, officers and key employees must complete an annual certification for conflicts of interests.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: For compensation of CEO and CFO, a comparative review is completed by the Audit Committee and subject to approval by the full Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation review for other officers and key employees is subject to a comparative review and is reviewed by the Personnel Committee and subject to approval by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, policies and financial statements of SCCHC are made available to the public upon request.
The organization operates under additional "Doing Business As" name:1. Ravenswood Family Health Center Pharmacy2. Ravenswood Family Dentistry.

Total non-cash contributions received by the organization was $1,914,134. Of this amount, $1,430,416 represented donated use of facilities and donated imaging services and $483,718 represented donated books and pharmaceutical drugs. Only the donated books and pharmaceutical drugs have been reported on line 1g and in Schedule M as per the instructions. The donated services and use of facilities has been reconciled in Schedule D, Part XI, Line 2b & Part XII, line 2a.

RFHC Bay/Pulgas Landowner, Inc. (RFHC BPL) was incorporated on April 1, 2015 as anonprofit public benefit corporation and it is organized under the California Nonprofit Public Benefit Corporation Law for public purposes. The Corporation is organized exclusively for religious, charitable, literary, or educational purposes within the meaning of Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The principal office of the Corporation is located at 1885 Bay Road, East Palo Alto,California 94303. RFHC BPL is controlled by South County Community Health Center, Inc. (SCCHC) and majority of the board is comprised of board members of SCCHC, but not exclusively. The purpose of the Corporation is to hold the leasehold interest in the commercial building located at 1885 Bay Road, East Palo Alto, California which is leased to SCCHC. RFHC BPL is considered to be a support organization to support the activities of SCCHC. RFHC BPL is operating the site in a manner enabling it to qualify as a Qualified Active low Income Beneficiary (QUALICB) that receives Qualified Low Income Investment (QLICI) loans under a New Market Tax Credit (NMTC) transaction.
